intro: Agalinis pulchella, commonly known as the pretty agalinis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, opposite leaves. Agalinis pulchella is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to thrive in environments with full sun exposure.
